result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Bjork recently court-appointed. Atty Bjork requests status conference. Waive speedy trial. Court sets PSC.  gll

records.addlTxt:
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Daniel R. or Elizabeth K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:13 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Alec Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Christopher Michael Kobs appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Victim E.K. makes statement. Court orders bond, but will not order testing at this time, as DE is on supervision. Court sets STC to check status of counsel. NG. Reserve pre-plea rights. Adjourned at 1:20 PM.  gll
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
